title: Why would a revolutionary fight so hard to overthrow a dictator and then turn into one after ruling for a while? - Quora

response.answer_text: The siren song of power is difficult to resist. Wealth is seductive. The definition of “enemy of the state” tends to be fluid. The line between “enemy of the state” and MY enemy becomes blurred. The definition of revolutionary in this context may require clarification. A fair number of rebel leaders aren’t trying to improve things for the general population. They’re trying to grab power for themselves or place their “tribe” in power. This is certainly the case for a large number of “revolutions” in Africa.
